intro: Hieracium erythrocarpum subsp. leilae, commonly known as the Leilae's red-fruited hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow to orange composite flowers and distinctive, hairy, reddish-orange fruits. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It has finely divided, grass-like leaves and produces a showy inflorescence that attracts pollinators. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
